MemberSignature.Value: public bool ElementAvailable (System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName name);
.method public hidebysig instance bool ElementAvailable(class System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName name) cil managed
Public Function ElementAvailable (name As XmlQualifiedName) As Boolean
public: bool ElementAvailable(System::Xml::XmlQualifiedName ^ name);
member this.ElementAvailable : System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName -> bool

Docs.summary: Evaluates the argument to a string that is an XML qualified name. This method implements the element-available function specified by [W3C XSL Transformations (XSLT)](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=49919).
Docs.returns: if the expanded name is the name of an instruction. If the has a namespace URI equal to the XSLT namespace URI, then it refers to an element defined by XSLT. Otherwise, the expanded-name refers to an extension element. If the has a null namespace URI, the element-available function will return .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The qualified name is expanded into an `expanded name` by using the namespace declarations in scope for the expression. The <xref:System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.XsltLibrary.ElementAvailable%2A> function returns `true` if and only if the `expanded name` is the name of an instruction.

MemberSignature.Value: public string FormatNumberDynamic (double value, string formatPicture, System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName decimalFormatName, string errorMessageName);
.method public hidebysig instance string FormatNumberDynamic(float64 value, string formatPicture, class System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName decimalFormatName, string errorMessageName) cil managed
Public Function FormatNumberDynamic (value As Double, formatPicture As String, decimalFormatName As XmlQualifiedName, errorMessageName As String) As String
public: System::String ^ FormatNumberDynamic(double value, System::String ^ formatPicture, System::Xml::XmlQualifiedName ^ decimalFormatName, System::String ^ errorMessageName);
member this.FormatNumberDynamic : double * string * System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName * string -> string

Docs.summary: Implements the format-number() XSLT function. For more information, see the number formatting section in the W3C Recommendation.
Docs.returns: A string that indicates the number format. For more information, see the number formatting section in the W3C Recommendation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.XsltLibrary.FormatNumberDynamic%2A> method formats `value` by using the `formatPicture` and decimal-format [expanded name](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=148269). The `errorMessageName` is used only for error reporting and must contain the qualified name of the decimal-format object.

Docs.summary: Implements the format-number() XSLT function. For more information, see the number formatting section in the W3C Recommendation.
Docs.returns: A string that indicates the format. For more information, see the number formatting section in the W3C Recommendation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.XsltLibrary.FormatNumberStatic%2A> method formats the given value by using the given decimal formatter object, created by <xref:System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.XsltLibrary.RegisterDecimalFormatter%2A>.

Docs.param: String that contains the format picture.
String that contains the infinity symbol.
String that contains the NaN symbol.
String that contains characters to format.
Docs.summary: Registers a decimal formatter object and returns a unique index assigned to it. The decimal formatter object is used by the format-number() XSLT function. For more information, see the number formatting section in the W3C Recommendation.
Docs.returns: A unique index assigned to a decimal formatter object.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool RelationalOperator (double opCode, System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem> left, System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem> right);

.method public hidebysig instance bool RelationalOperator(float64 opCode, class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem> left, class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem> right) cil managed
Public Function RelationalOperator (opCode As Double, left As IList(Of XPathItem), right As IList(Of XPathItem)) As Boolean

public: bool RelationalOperator(double opCode, System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::Xml::XPath::XPathItem ^> ^ left, System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::Xml::XPath::XPathItem ^> ^ right);
member this.RelationalOperator : double * System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem> * System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem> -> bool

Docs.param:
Specifies how to perform the evaluation of two expressions:
If opCode is equal to 2, evaluates the XPath expression "left < right".
If opCode is equal to 3, evaluates the XPath expression "left <= right".
If opCode is equal to 4, evaluates the XPath expression "left > right".
If opCode is equal to 5, evaluates the XPath expression "left >= right"
Docs.summary: Evaluates whether the expression is greater than or equal to, or less than or equal to, the expression based on the passed.
Docs.returns: A Boolean value that is true if the left expression is greater than or equal to the right expression.
